data.title: Delicious Burgers!
data.text:
Who knew, Sunday night special $5 off every burger!  The burgers were delicious - cooked perfectly, melted cheese, chipotle bbq sauce.  They are quite big and we thought after the fact that we probably could have shared one.  The French fries were very good as well and plenty of them!

Sat at the bar, bartend was very nice.  It is in an old building but they recently renovated the bar area.

data.title: Porterhouse Pork Chop
data.text:
An old school bar with some modern flavor. 
I ordered the Porterhouse Pork Chop, it was HUGE! It was also delicious! The staff was polite and helpful. They have a nice selection of beers. I ordered "Burn the Ships" IPA by local brewery Able Ebenezer Brewing Co. I typically steer clear of IPA's but it was good!

data.title: Modest Ambience; Great Food
data.text:
This is an older venue.  It has some historic significance in the city in that formerly it was a hotel; later enjoyed a checkered history as a rooming house; currently the only floor that is occupied is the restaurant.

The restaurant has an older feel; the outdoor patio was a fairly recent build on.  The restrooms are older still; but adequate.

We visited completely spur of the moment; a party of 5.  5 completely different menu choices; and all were great.  The food was well presented; hot and well serviced.  Able Ebenezer is a local micro brew; and it's "Burn The Ships IPA" was worth a repeat draft.  The other drink choices at the table were mainstream; but fairly priced.

To be fair it is a property that is a little long in the tooth; but clean.  The food out of the kitchen was great !  Nothing not to like....

data.title: Fab outdoor deck at historic pub
data.text: I was expecting a dive bar but this place was a couple steps above that. Still nothing fancy, but certainly historic and comfortable. Great outdoor seat for warm spring and summer nights.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Went here for dinner Saturday night and was my first time. First impression was we where at a casual old pub. Our waitress Liz was very nice. She brought corn bread but the plates where dirty or old and stained, Liz gave us new plates but they looked the same.  She highly recommended the Rib Eye so Deb ordered that and I got steak tips and corn and cheddar risotto. The steak tips where probably the best I ever had and the risotto awesome. The rib eye just plain sucked, mostly fat and grizzle and luke warm. It was obvious because her plate was fluff waste and when we mentioned it to Liz she surprised us by saying nothing. $26.00 is a lot for a plate full of fat ! I know the pub is old but they really should clean around the wood and exposed metal pipes full of dirt. I would have given this place another try because of how good my tips where but very insulting to get no response on the crappy rib eye. A tip, hire a high school kid 2 hours a day to clean the place and it will be  a good investment.

data.title: Top notch food and service
data.text: I have lived in Nashua my entire life and yet i had never been to Fodys. It is the oldest building in Nashua and I had heard very good things about it in the last few years. My wife and I decided to try it last Saturday night and we were so impressed!! Such a charming little place. Tremendous atmosphere. Our server, Carlos, was so helpful and his service was impeccable. great attention to detail. Since it was our first time we asked what was his recommendation and he talked us both into the burgundy steak tips. They were DELICIOUS. Literally as tender as could be. And flavorful as i have ever experienced. Definetly going to make Fodys one of our regular spots from now on. Very impressed.

data.title: Enjoyable, friendly
data.text: Fody's Tavern was first erected in 1833, then somehow moved across the street to new foundation in early 1900, use horse and chains.  Great staff. Large serving sizes.  Lobster BLT was very good-- could share,. cornbread very good, but unusually crumbly, hard to butter. Burn the Ships IPA  was a unique beer offering for someone not usually a fan of IPAs. Wish my iPhone had not died. Liked decor.

data.title: Great Value at a Great Tavern!
data.text: Very accomodating to 9 of us on a Sunday evening around 7:30PM.  Food was great and so was the service.  We were from out of town visiting....wish we had a Fodys near us.

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: After getting a late start, we went to Fodys on a Sunday night because their kitchen would be open until 9:30.  Our server was attentive, but not intrusive. A basket of small corn bread loaves, which were very good,  was placed on our table. We ordered cocktails and an appetizer.  The cosmo was not a typical cosmo - it was thicker and a little disappointing.  However, the calamari appetizer was anything but disappointing.  It was crisp, tender and the spicy sauce complimented it.  We then ordered two of their special burgers that came with fries.  They were large enough for us to bring half of each one home for lunch the next day.  Burgers were great, but the best part was that because we were there on a Sunday, burgers were discounted $5 each!  We will be back.

data.title: Nope
data.text: So I have a rule, if the bathroom is nasty I don't eat there.  The bathroom was falling apart and kind of nasty but nasty enough.  I got a jack and ginger at the bar and was flat. I have become a food snob over the years and I am quick to judge so this places food never got to my stomach.  When bathroom is dirty and soda is flat that tells me someone is lazy and doesnt care and I can only assume the kitchen is treated the same way

data.title: Very rude bartender
data.text: Rudest bartender on thursday night. When I kindly mentioned that he could probably use more help he took the menu away and said "i don't need your criticism". Horrible service and apparently he didn't want any customers.

data.title: love this place :-)
data.text: great drinks, food, and fun at this cozy spot with outdoor seating and very engaging bar staff. don't miss live music nights.. maybe you'll see us there ;-)

data.title: Haunted Tavern
data.text:
It was our 1st time at Fody's. Went on a Sunday, which i $5.00 off burger night. We sat on the deck and it was lovely. Being near Main Street one would think it would be noisy, but it wasn't.
Carlo, our waiter, was excellent.
Our hamburgers & drink were great. 
Very busy inside, and that surprised us, as it was a Sunday night
Great service.

data.title: Friendly beer and burgers at the bar
data.text:
My husband and I visited Fody's for the first time last night.  We were actually intending to go to a place around the corner but it was closed, so we took a chance and sat at the Bar.  Liz, the bartender is very personable and gave us a bit of the history of the building - everything from ghosts to hookers!  We had draft beer and split the corn chowder which was actually pretty tasty.  We also shared the pot-sticker app which wasn't as light as one would expect in an Asian restaurant, but nonetheless, they were tasty and the dipping sauce had a good kick.  Lastly, we shared the mushroom burger which was pretty good and cooked to our liking - medium rare.

While Fody's probably won't be a regular place for us, this one stop was good enough that we would give it a second shot!

data.title: Great burger
data.text: So..... we came un because we craving burgers. The drinks were good and the service was friendly. The burgers came out quick and looked yummy. As i was eating a piece of hair was found on the plate. I was shocked that this was the case. That being said it was good till i saw it.

data.title: Great location; great history, disappointing meal
data.text: Having not visited Fody's - a casual restaurant in a historic downtown building - in over a year, we were looking forward to what we remembered as a superior shepards pie and chicken pot pie. Although the atmosphere remained cozy the pot pie was really watery chicken soup, albeit with some good chicken parts. The shepherd's pie was surprisingly cheesy. It will be even longer before our next visit.

data.title: Downtown Nashua Hidden Gem
data.text: My wife and I frequent downtown Nashua eateries on a regular basis but just never had Fody's on our list. Its tucked away on a side street (ClintonSt) which runs parallel to Main St on library hill. We ended up there because our original plan for St Patricks Day didnt work out at a nearby eatery. We both had corned beef and cabbage which was excellent but what really makes us want to go back was some of the other dishes we saw coming out, but mostly because of our server (they all seemed very friendly and on the same team). after realizing it was our firdt time here,she proudly told us about the chef, the building (very historical - built in 1933), the owner and all of their specials. She really believed in this place - which is huge!!! The Sesame grilled Tuna that went to the table next to us looked awesome and will be my choice for our follow-up visit. The special we plan on taking advantage of is their Tuesday buy one entree and get one free deal. This special is typically seen at the chain restaurants and not at a small eatery with well thought out menu items that are already at a reasonable price. This place definitely deserves a try.

data.title: Gone downhill fast
data.text:
I used to frequent here with all my friends, but now we avoid it like the plague. Everything that made it great is gone. It has gotten so bad that I absolutely had to update my formerly 5-star review.

The big comfy chairs are all gone and replaced by boring TGI Friday's seating.

The bartender can't do anything right except open a beer anymore.

The food used to be great, and is now bland and poorly-prepared.

The bathrooms are in shambles, barely even able to be used. Literally, they are falling apart.

And the clientele they are aiming for appears to have likewise been flushed. My friend and I had the unfortunate experience to attend on a "comedy night." The jokes were all gross-out oriented, and literally made us unable to finish our meals. 

It's such a shame, because "going to Fody's" used to be something we all looked forward to. Now we warn our out-of-town friends away.

data.title: Amazing Burgers
data.text: I have now visited 3 times!  I am in love with their burgers! They are so good! The drinks aren't bad either!  I will definitely keep going!  Maybe I will even stay for one of the live bands one night!

data.title: Best Restaurant in Nashua
data.text:
I was at Fody's last night, and made a mental note to drop a review here on Tripadvisor.  My husband and I go to Fody's about once every other month.  Last night, I had a new menu item, the tuna tacos, and they were excellent.  I also had the friend green tomato salad, which was also wonderful.  

I know Fody's has had some ups and downs over the years (other friends have commented), but our experience has been quite positive the last couple years.  I think the quality of the food, and the value and atmosphere makes it one of, if not the best, restaurant in Nashua.
